instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 810-01814-A 2019 15" Touch Bar Liquid Damage
threads.message: Customer brought in a 2019 15" MacBook Pro Touch bar with some coffee damage. Makes charger ding when plugged in but shows nothing on internal or external screen. Upon further inspection it looks to not be making it to an s0 state as cpu and gpu are ice cold and has no vcore. I know i have at least <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> Only signs of liquid on the board on on the right side near touch bar connector. This is the first T2 board i've worked on.

threads.title: 810-01814-A 2019 15" Touch Bar Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Dou you get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Also check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>3_L</SIGNAL> pulse at least.

This could be hopeless project, as no chematic, nor boardview available...

threads.title: 810-01814-A 2019 15" Touch Bar Liquid Damage
threads.message: 12.61v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G2H</SIGNAL>. I dont have <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, no luck with smc bypass. and have no good place to check for <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> that matches <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview. On USB Amp meter it will take 20v and .3amps for a few seconds then drop to 20v at 0amp.

threads.title: 810-01814-A 2019 15" Touch Bar Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Probably liquid affected more areas, as I already saw close to one <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.
Put good flux and heat BGA chips, starting with PMIC.

threads.title: 810-01814-A 2019 15" Touch Bar Liquid Damage
threads.message: Everything else looks brand new. Usually boards with coffee damage have trails of coffee stains on the board.

threads.title: 810-01814-A 2019 15" Touch Bar Liquid Damage
threads.message: Ok so after some searching looks like this board is an updated <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Have a much closer schematic now
